narrative.title: Panzergruppe Afrika - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: German Panzer Army Group deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: Combined German-Italian Panzer Army Group conducting mobile armored warfare and siege operations in North Africa. Mission: Capture Tobruk fortress, defeat British Eighth Army in Western Desert, advance to Suez Canal. Q4 1941 reality: Defensive operations during British Operation Crusader offensive (November 18 - December 20), followed by forced withdrawal to El Agheila (December 15). Panzergruppe Afrika commanded three corps: DAK (German armored striking force), XX Corps (Italian mobile armored/motorized), XXI Corps (Italian static infantry). Rommel exercised operational control over Italian formations from 24 November 1941 despite formal Italian command structure under Comando Supremo. Strategic context: Understrength relative to British Eighth Army, chronic supply crisis due to Mediterranean interdiction, no strategic reserve, competing for resources with Eastern Front (Operation Barbarossa). End Q4 status: Tobruk siege failed, territorial losses severe (withdrew from Cyrenaica), but Panzergruppe escaped destruction and held defensive line at El Agheila-Mersa Brega.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

special_rules: Highly mobile combined-arms armored warfare in desert terrain (DAK)
Innovative use of 88mm FlaK in anti-tank role - decisive advantage against British cruiser tanks
Aggressive reconnaissance to locate enemy dispositions and identify weaknesses
Rapid deployment and concentration of forces at decisive points
Night movement and repositioning to evade British air superiority
Combined German-Italian operations under unified command (from 24 November 1941)
Exploitation of British tactical weaknesses (fragmented command, hesitant execution)
Fighting withdrawal under pressure - conducted organized retreat 600km without rout
